subject: College Athletics
lead_paragraph: Penn State linebacker Sean Lee tore a knee ligament during practice and will most likely miss next season. He injured the anterior cruciate ligament in his right knee Friday. Lee, the leading returning tackler for the Nittany Lions, will have surgery within the next month and will need about nine months of rehabilitation, the team doctor said.
